title: Grants Accountant
description:
**Project FIND’s mission** is to provide low- and moderate-income and homeless seniors with the services and support they need to enrich their lives and live independently. Today Project FIND operates three supportive housing residences that are home to about 600 people and four senior centers with over 3,000 members. Our members and residents range from the healthy and active to the frail and homebound to the homeless. For all these men and women, Project FIND is a critical resource, providing housing, meals, and programs that help individuals navigate the challenges of aging by encouraging community engagement and healthy living. Please visit our website at: www.projectfind.org.

 **Job Summary:**



The Grants Accountant works to ensure the organization meets financial goals with respect to accounting and audits. Under the leadership of the Director of Finance, the Grants Accountant collaborates with the controller to manage the agency’s grants and budget management functions, including timely filing of funder vouchers and provides technical assistance and support to administrative staff including program directors and department heads, to help ensure effective ongoing budget management. The Grants Accountant will provide support during the agency's annual independent audit, as well as audits and fiscal reviews from funding agencies and regulators.


**Responsibilities include:**

 **Grants and Contracts**


* The Grants Accountant under general supervision, manages the financial intricacies of grants, ensuring compliance with regulations and fostering effective collaboration with program staff
* Prepare detailed financial reports for timely submission to grantors, actively participate in budget development and conduct thorough financial analyses to address variances
* Maintain meticulous documentation, facilitate audit processes, and stay current with accounting standards and grant regulations
* Manage the financial aspects of grants, public and private foundation funding from inception to completion, ensuring compliance with grant guidelines and regulations
* Prepare grant proposal budgets, providing financial input and ensuring alignment with organizational goals
* Collaborate with Director of Finance, Director of Development & External Relations, and Program Leadership to develop grant budgets and monitor expenditures throughout the grant period
* Conduct regular financial analysis to identify variances and address potential budgetary concerns
* Prepare and submit timely and accurate financial reports or vouchers to grantors, detailing fund utilization and performance against budget
* Maintain organized grant documentation, including financial reports, invoices, and correspondence with grantors
* Coordinate with internal and external auditors and grantors during the grant-related audits
* Monitoring and supporting adherence to audit and grant requirements
* Stay abreast of changes in accounting standards and grant regulations to ensure compliance
* Manage other administrative functions, and special projects
* Assist the fiscal team with the development and preparation of the annual reports and fiscal year budgets for the related entities
* Assist the controller, with contract registration, budget submission, modifications and amendments, close-outs, and other required processes for grants and contracts to ensure timely registration and reimbursements

  


**Accounts Payable**


* Oversee staff salary allocation process, assist programs with employee allocation changes and review variance reports to ensure allocation accuracy
* Analyze monthly revenue and expense reports to ensure accuracy and any variance that need to be addressed with assistance from the controller
* Provide support to cover functions in the agency’s Finance Department, particularly in payroll, AP, AR, Bank Reconciliation, reporting and maintains an understanding of these functions for cross-training purposes
* Collect and maintain monthly, quarterly, and annual reports in an organized and accessible file
* Provide support with monthly closeouts
* Perform other related duties as assigned

 **Qualifications:**


* Bachelor's degree in accounting (preferred) and/or a Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in accounting, with at least 2 years in grant accounting, preferably in a nonprofit environment.
* Strong understanding of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP), Uniform Guidance and grant compliance
* Experience with federal, state, and local government grants.
* Strong knowledge of nonprofit accounting principles and grant management.
* Proficiency in accounting software and pay systems (e.g., Avid Pay, QuickBooks, Sage Intacct, Fund-EZ) and Microsoft Office Suite (especially Excel).
* Excellent analytical skills and attention to detail.
* Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain financial concepts to non-financial staff.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team, with strong organizational and time management skills.
* Advanced knowledge and experience with spreadsheets
* Ability to work independently

  



Project FIND participates in E-Verify, which confirms employment authorization through an electronic database maintained by the Social Security Administration and Department of Homeland Security. The E-Verify process is completed in conjunction with the Form I-9 Employment Eligibility Verification. E-Verify is not used as a tool to pre-screen candidates.

title: Indoor Horticulturist-NYC
description:
**Want to make places beautiful?**



Our Indoor Horticulturists meticulously care for tropical plantscapes throughout businesses, shopping centers, hotels and residential buildings. These landscapes vary from living walls, atriums, containerized plantings, and seasonal designs. This NYC territory serves clients throughout Manhattan, Brooklyn, and Queens.

  

The Horticulturist exudes passion for the green industry, and will apply their knowledge and expertise to ensuring best plant care practices are implemented (watering, pruning, plant health ID).



This individual should enjoy working independently. Friendly, courteous customer service skills are a must!

  

1-3 years experience with plant care, gardening, or general landscaping is preferred.



An educational background in plant science, interior-scape, horticulture, or environmental sciences is encouraged!

  



Who we are looking for:


* Someone seeking purpose in their work and a passion for the impact their work has on their community
* Someone full of optimism and positivity
* Someone comfortable making mistakes and an appreciation for constant learning
* Someone who isn’t afraid to roll up their sleeves and work hard

  



What you can expect from us:


* A complex and unique culture
* An environment that is not stagnant, we’re always solving problems and working hard for growth
* An ongoing investment in our people, including rising wages and benefits
* A team that’s been around for 50 years and plans to be around for another 50
* A renewed focus on equity in the workplace
* A microscope on our environmental footprint as a business

  



Check out our website and see for yourself: https://johnmini.bamboohr.com/jobs



We can't wait to hear from you!

  

At John Mini Distinctive Landscapes, we make places beautiful. Entering our fifth decade, we are recognized as a leader in indoor and outdoor landscaping and holiday design. We design, install and maintain landscapes all over the tri-state area of New York, New Jersey, and Connecticut. We're a team that’s been around for 50 years and plan to be around for another 50!

title: Healthcare Coding Specialist
description:
**Healthcare Coding Specialist**

  


**Job Summary**:



The ideal candidate will be an expert in SQL and be able to develop insightful data visualizations to support decision-making processes. A background in healthcare is essential for understanding and analyzing complex medical data.

  




**Key Responsibilities**


* **SQL:**
	+ Design, develop, and maintain complex SQL queries, stored procedures, and functions.
	+ Optimize database performance and troubleshoot issues.
	+ Ensure data integrity and security across all database systems.
	+ Collaborate with population health and EMR vendors to integrate various data sources.
* **Data Visualization:**
	+ Develop and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
	+ Translate complex data sets into clear and actionable visual insights.
	+ Work with stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver customized solutions.
	+ Continuously improve visualization techniques and methodologies.
* **Healthcare Data Management:**
	+ Extract and manage data from various EHRs (Athena, Allscripts, Amazing Charts, eCW)
	+ Ensure compliance with healthcare regulations and data standards (e.g., HIPAA).
	+ Stay up to date with industry trends and advancements in data analysis, visualization tools, and healthcare analytics.
	+ Support clinical and operational teams with data-driven insights to enhance patient care and operational efficiency.
	+ Ensure data quality and integrity by performing regular audits and validations.
  


**Qualifications**


* **Education:**
	+ Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field. Master’s degree preferred.
* **Experience:**
	+ 3+ years of experience in SQL development and database management.
	+ Proven experience in data visualization and dashboard development.
	+ Strong background in healthcare data and knowledge of healthcare industry standards and regulations.
* **Technical Skills:**
	+ Proficiency in SQL and experience with relational databases such as SQL Server, MySQL.
	+ Expertise in data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
	+ Familiarity with ETL processes and tools.
	+ Understanding of data warehousing concepts and best practices.
* **Soft Skills:**
	+ Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
	+ Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
	+ Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy and quality.
  


**Preferred Qualifications**


* Experience with cloud-based data platforms (e.g., Snowflake).
* Knowledge of programming languages such as Python or R for data analysis.
* Certification in SQL, data visualization, or healthcare data management.

  


**How to Apply:** Interested candidates should submit their resume and a cover letter detailing their relevant experience demonstrating their experience in SQL and data visualizations.

title: Pricing Analyst
description:
Paul Hastings is a leading international law firm that provides innovative legal solutions to many of the world's top financial institutions and Fortune Global 500 companies. With a strong presence throughout Asia, Europe, Latin America, and the U.S., we have the global reach and extensive capabilities to provide personalized service wherever our clients’ needs take us. As one of the world’s leading law firms, we seek dynamic individuals who share our commitment to service, innovation, and professional growth.


We have an opening for a Pricing Analyst.


This role offers the opportunity to learn from a seasoned expert in Legal Pricing. The Pricing Analyst will be responsible for developing pricing structures, including alternative fee proposals, as part of our firmwide pricing strategy. Reporting to the Manager of Strategic Pricing, this position will play a key role in interacting with firm partners and leaders to provide analytics, reporting, and tools that support our pricing vision. The Pricing Analyst will engage directly with Partners, Clients, and various cross-departmental contacts within Paul Hastings.


In this capacity, the Pricing Analyst will:

* **Pricing Strategy Development:**
	+ Collaborate with attorneys and management to develop and refine pricing strategies for various legal services; and
	+ Conduct market research and competitive analysis to inform pricing decisions and adjust strategies as needed.
* **Data Analysis and Reporting:**
	+ Analyze historical billing data, client financials, and market trends to create pricing models and forecasts; and
	+ Prepare detailed reports and presentations to support pricing recommendations and strategic decisions.
* **Client Proposals and Fee Arrangements:**
	+ Assist in developing client proposals, including alternative fee arrangements, fixed fees, and contingency fees; and
	+ Work with the client development team to ensure proposals are competitive and aligned with client expectations.
* **Financial Modeling:**
	+ Create and maintain financial models to project revenue impacts of different pricing scenarios; and
	+ Monitor pricing effectiveness and make recommendations for adjustments based on performance metrics.
* **Internal Collaboration:**
	+ Partner with finance, billing, and practice group leaders to ensure pricing strategies are integrated into the firm’s overall financial goals; and
	+ Provide training and support to attorneys and staff on pricing strategies and tools.
* **Compliance and Best Practices:**
	+ Ensure pricing practices comply with relevant regulations and internal policies; and
	+ Stay current with industry best practices and emerging trends in legal pricing.


Proficiencies:

* Advanced financial analysis skills, including the ability to prepare concise reports to assist firm management in assessing the effectiveness and financial impact of pricing proposals and matter debriefs;
* Advanced knowledge of mathematical and basic statistical concepts, including fractions, percentages, and ratios, and the ability to apply this knowledge to large volumes of data to reach meaningful conclusions;
* Expert level of proficiency in Word, Excel, and PowerPoint;
* Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to interact effectively with attorneys and firm professional staff at all levels;
* Advanced organizational skills, including the ability to maintain and track large volumes of data, prioritize workload, coordinate multiple projects simultaneously, meet deadlines, and adapt to change;
* High level of attention to detail;
* Ability to learn, leverage, and use additional programs, including budgeting and financial management software;
* Working knowledge of legal services, financial, and billing systems;
* Ability to work independently and be proactive; and
* Proven success working in teams, both virtually and in person.


Qualifications

* Bachelor’s Degree (required);
* At least 3+ years of related experience in a law firm or professional services firm (preferred); and
* At least 3+ years’ experience with pricing of legal services preferred, including a strong working knowledge of non-hourly pricing models.


Employees will be provided with an excellent career opportunity in a collaborative environment, in addition to a generous total compensation package with the opportunity to earn bonuses based on individual contribution and firm profitability.


The salary wage range that we expect to pay for this position is a minimum of $88,000 and a maximum of $112,300 annually. The actual pay wage may vary based on experience or other relevant factors.


Eligible employees can participate in the Firm’s comprehensive benefits program, which include the following:

* Medical, Dental, Vision, Life/AD&D, Long Term Care, and Short and Long Term Disability
* Flexible Spending Account and Health Savings Account
* Healthcare Concierge and Advocacy
* Voluntary 401k Plan and Profit Sharing
* 10 Paid Holidays per year and a generous PTO program
* Family Support including Pediatric Mental Health and Parental Support, Paid Parental Leave, Fertility Benefits, and Breast Milk Shipping
* Back-up Child Care, Elder Care, and Tutoring
* Wellness Programs (Employee Assistance Program, Mental Health, and Well-Being Events)
* Retirement Plan Consulting
* Anniversary Bonus Program
* Professional Development Programs
* Transportation Allowance and Commuter Benefits
* International Travel Insurance
* Auto/Home/Legal Insurance
* Pet Insurance
* Employee discounts
* And more!


The Firm has a range of diversity initiatives including our Paul Hastings Affinity Networks (PHANs), Women’s Initiative, and PH Balanced. These initiatives provide a firmwide forum to share experiences, as well as an opportunity to participate in a supportive network with common interests to help make life at the firm more inclusive. Learn more about our Global Diversity, Inclusion and Wellness Initiatives here.

*Paul Hastings LLP is an equal employment and affirmative action employer F/M/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity.*

title: Manager of Payor Relations
description:
The Manager of Payor Relations is responsible for assisting the RCM Team in negotiating, maintenance, problem resolution and internal coordination of assigned managed care contracts and proposals. Works with the Director of RCM and others to manage the contract process. Acts as a service representative for internal clients and payors, scheduling in-services as needed and works to provide information to the Company to enable them to operationalize their managed care agreements.

  

This position will be responsible for a wide variety of duties related to the development, implementation, and ongoing management of the Company managed care contracting function. Company contracts contribute to the overall mission, vision and strategy of the Company with a focus on contract administration, review and analysis of contract proposals, development of managed care strategies, and a liaison role to both external and internal customers and other special projects.

 **Skills and Competencies:**



Excellent communication and presentation skills, financial acumen, relationship building, knowledge of antitrust laws and regulations, ability to tactfully navigate healthcare environment with various key parties

 **Job Responsibilities:**



Responsible for maintaining contracting files, coordinating with credentialing with health plans and coordinates and uploaded in all systems. Responsible to properly support managed care tables and reporting capabilities. Supports the management team by providing input into the strategic planning process.

 **1)** Assist in the development of an overall strategy for the managed care activities. Review contract language, rate and fee proposals, complete market analysis comparisons and evaluate proposal and present to senior leadership and membership


**2)** Participate, develop, maintain and communicate alternative payment methodologies (risk sharing, shared savings, bundle & global payment arrangements, pay for performance programs, etc.)


**3)** Act as a liaison to internal customers, (Ops, Exec Team), and external partners (payer contracting and provider relations management)


**4)** Disseminate and understand healthcare market and industry changes including impacts due to Affordable Care Act, State Health Exchange and regulatory requirements and communicate the impact of these changes to the stakeholders


**5)** Provide supervision and mentoring of future support staff


**6)** Follow-up and address with payers global contracting issues encountered by practices/members. Ensure and interpret payer compliance to contract language and provisions and follow-up on any issues as appropriate


**7)** Develop, review and communicate operational and clinical requirements. Assist with pay for performance and bonus program settlement and distribution process

 **Required Work Experience:**



5 years Healthcare, Managed Cared, Payer experience, preferably in the Northeast

 **Education:**



Bachelor of Science (Required)

 **What We Offer**

* 401(k) & 401(k) Matching
* Health Insurance (Medical, Dental, Vision)
* Life Insurance
* Paid Time Off

title: Ophthalmic Technician
description:
We are an established multi-specialty Ophthalmology group looking for an experienced ophthalmic technician. Technicians must be compassionate, detail-oriented team players with great people skills and a desire to grow in a friendly practice. As the Ophthalmic Technician your primary job function is to work with the ophthalmologist to provide exceptional patient care by gathering all patient information necessary to complete a proper diagnosis. You will perform the initial patient examinations, ophthalmic testing procedures as well as assist the physician as directed. Your top priority will be to ensure the patient receives the highest level of care as our main goal is to make the patient experience as exemplary as possible.

  

Hours: up to 40 hours/week

  

Job Responsibilities:


* Interview patients and document ocular and medical histories


* Perform preliminary testing i.e.: visual acuity, pupillary responses, confrontation visual fields, motility, stereopsis, color vision, angle assessment, refractometry and applanation tonometry.


* Perform diagnostic testing including automated perimetry, OCT, A&B scans, optical biometry and ophthalmic photography, fluorescein angiography, corneal topography and keratometry


* Assist in minor surgery procedures, laser surgery, laser refractive surgery and crosslinking


* Monitor and facilitate patient flow in the clinic and in the imaging rooms, working collaboratively with other clinical staff.


* Administer eye drops as required by the physician. (Certification Required)


* Perform clinical and administrative duties as directed

  

Minimum Qualifications:  

High School Diploma or equivalent required.

  

Preferred Qualifications:  

Certified Ophthalmic Assistant Certification

  

Special Skills:


* Ability to work well with others.
* Reliable
* Excellent communication skills
* Data entry and typing skills.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
* Exceptional customer service skills
* Proven experience as an Ophthalmic Technician
* Knowledge medical office procedures

  



Benefits:

  

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Referral program
* Vision insurance

  



Medical specialties:

  

* Ophthalmology

  



Schedule:

  

* Monday to Friday

  



Education:

  

* High school or equivalent (Preferred)

  



Experience:

  

* Ophthalmology Experience: 1 year (Preferred)

  



Work Location: In person

title: Part-time Residential R.N.
description:
**Residential RN –** Residential Services for Developmentally Disabled Adults


**Part-time (9 hrs/wk.)**

 ***Catholic Charities of Long Island models the love of Jesus by offering dignified and compassionate care to poor and vulnerable neighbors of every faith and background. In-person service at more than 50 sites throughout Nassau and Suffolk counties is inspired by the Gospel call affirming the sacredness of every human life.***

  

***CCLI is looking for a Part-time R.N. with a generous heart and a desire to contribute to the well-being of others to carry out our mission on Long Island. By joining our team, you will share in the joy of providing “care with dignity and life with hope.”***

 ***Program Description***:



Catholic Charities operates 12 community residences on LI where residents with developmental disabilities are helped to achieve their highest level of functioning and to participate fully in the surrounding community.

 ***Position Description***: We are seeking a Residential RN to assume RN oversight of medical/medication- related issues for every resident in the residence in conjunction with the DSPs, Medical Care Counselor and Manager. In this role, the Residential RN will ensure compliance within the program of all medical/medication-related OPWDD regulations and related Agency policies and procedures.

 ***Key Responsibilities***:


* Provide direct nursing oversight to confirm that the highest quality of care is provided in all medical situations.
* Supervise medical and AMAP staff ensuring compliance with required documentation and training.
* Initiate positive interventions and resolutions of all medical care/medication/AMAP related issues.
* Report discrepancies and/or problems related to medical care/follow up and AMAP administration to Healthcare Administrator.
* Participate as active member of Treatment Team advising Team of any significant changes.
* Assume On-Call Beeper responsibilities in accordance with published schedule.
* Provide workshops/training on health-related issues for staff, clients and families.
* Attend medical appointments and ensure that hospitalized residents receive RN follow up.
* Discuss professional issues via telephone or in person with residents, families, Agency personnel as needed.

  


***Requirements***:


* Bachelor’s degree in nursing and NYS certification
* 5 years practical nursing experience
* Previous experience working with developmentally disabled populations required
* Valid current NYS driver’s license
* Able to work flexible hours

  


***Schedule***: Must be flexible to accommodate alternating days and hours

  


***This rate of pay serves as a good faith estimate. Actual pay is based on a number of factors which may include a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies, experience and work location. The salary range or rate listed does not include any differential pay or other forms of compensation, such as the value of benefits, which may be applicable to this position.***

title: OPWDD RN Administrator
description:
Catholic Charities of Long Island models the love of Jesus by offering dignified and compassionate care to poor and vulnerable neighbors of every faith and background. In-person service at more than 50 sites throughout Nassau and Suffolk counties is inspired by the Gospel call affirming the sacredness of every human life.

  




CCLI is looking for an ***OPWDD*** ***RN Administrator*** with a generous heart and a desire to contribute to the well-being of others by providing “care with dignity and life with hope.” The ***RN Administrator*** is responsible for the clinical and behavioral care provided to 103 individuals residing in 12 homes across Long Island.

  




***Responsibilities:***


***Staff Supervision and Development:***


* Directly supervise clinical staff consisting of Registered Nurses and Behavioral Services in daily program operations including staff scheduling, evaluating, counseling, training and disciplining, when necessary
* Conduct monthly clinical staff meetings for Registered Nurses offering ongoing training and support
* Direct assignments and determine schedules for On Call RN’s
* Provide 24-7 on-call coverage as back up for Registered Nurses when others are unavailable. Ensuring prompt communication/documentation of all triaged calls as well as nursing visits with follow ups on hospitalizations, rehabs, off site facilities, as needed


***Compliance:***


* Ensure compliance with OPWDD Tuberculosis regulations, including, reviewing and monitoring test documentation for new and existing staff
* Oversee Full AMAP classes, including scheduling, facilitating and developing/revising training materials according to OPWDD requirements
* Oversee clinical database for various functions (AMAP certification, Clinician trainings, medication errors) reviewing and approving data to be entered to ensure compliance with OPWDD regulations
* Provide clinical staff guidance when conducting internal audits of medical records
* Partner with Quality Assurance Coordinator providing necessary information for investigations, compliance and implement clinical corrective actions, as needed
* Active member of the IRC and HRC committees, offering suggestions/recommendations for improvements and ensure timely implementation/follow up on approved clinical next steps
  


***Qualifications:***


* Bachelor’s Degree and valid NYS Registered Nurse License, required
* 5 years of developmental disabilities field experience with demonstrated clinical skills and knowledge of OPWDD regulations, preferred
* 3-5 years of RN staff management, preferred
* Valid NYS Driver’s License. + ability to travel to all residences located across Long Island, as need, (position is based out of Amityville, LI)
* Comfortable with 24/7 On Call availability

  


*This rate of pay serves as a good faith estimate. Actual pay is based on a number of factors which may include a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies, experience and work location. The salary range or rate listed does not include any differential pay or other forms of compensation, such as the value of benefits, which may be applicable to this position**.*

description:

As Assistant Manager, you will assist the Residence Manager in providing “person-centered care” by encouraging teamwork, supervising staff, observing regulatory requirements and ensuring effective house operations.

Performing hands-on Direct Support Professional duties as needed, including transporting and accompanying residents into the community, providing direct care, performing household maintenance duties.  
*

title: Midwife
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


Elmhurst Hospital Center (EHC) is the major tertiary care provider in the borough of Queens. The hospital is comprised of 545 beds and is a Level I Trauma Center, an Emergency Heart Care Station and a 911 Receiving Hospital. It is the premiere health care organization for key areas such as Surgery, Cardiology, Women's Health, Pediatrics, Rehabilitation Medicine, Renal and Mental Health Services.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.


**Work Shifts**
---------------

  


Rotating


**Job Description**
-------------------

  


Under the supervision of Midwifery Services and direction of the OB/GYN Division, provides antepartum, intrapartum, postpartum, neonatal, interconceptional and gynecological care in accordance with written midwifery protocols which have been approved by the Institution’s Medical Board.


**Duties & Responsibilities**
-----------------------------

  


1. Plans and provides health care for women and newborn infants.


2. Establishes a complete database concerning the patient through history taking, physical examination and appropriate laboratory data.


3. Assesses the status of the patient, develops and implements a plan of care with the patient during the prenatal, intrapartal, postpartal, neonatal and interconceptional/gynecological periods.


4. Provides guidance and education for patients and families concerning health maintenance, admission and discharge, and labor management (including physical and emotional support).


5. Manages labor, including delivery of the newborn, utilizes medication and performs procedures.


6. Provides immediate and follow-up care of the newborn infant, including an ongoing assessment and follow-up with the postpartum family.


7. Seeks medical consultation for patients with deviations from standards/guidelines.


8. Performs ongoing review of care, including evaluation and documentation in the medical record.


9. Provides contraceptive guidance and evaluation and treatment for minor gynecological condition.


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

  


Licensure as a Midwife by the New York State Department of Education.


**How To Apply**
----------------

  


If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online at employment.nychhc.org.


NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs
company_description: We always put patients first! NYCHHC is committed to excellence in health care and the safety of people in the City of New York.

title: Part-time Office Housekeeper/Cleaning Consultant
description:
**Part-time Office Housekeeper / Cleaning Consultant**

 **Work Schedule: Monday - Friday from 11:00 am to 3:00 pm (4 hours per day, 20 hours per week)**


**Work Location: Midtown Manhattan Corporate office for Dana-co**

 **Job Description:**

  

We are seeking a diligent and detail-oriented Office Housekeeper / Cleaning Consultant to maintain cleanliness and hygiene standards in our corporate office in midtown Manhattan. The ideal candidate will be responsible for ensuring that all areas of the office are clean, organized, and presentable, creating a comfortable and pleasant work environment for our employees and visitors.

 **Responsibilities:**

  


* Perform regular cleaning and maintenance tasks to ensure a tidy and sanitary office environment.
* Dusting and wiping down surfaces, including desks, tables, chairs, shelves, and other furniture.
* Vacuuming and mopping floors to remove dirt, debris, and stains.
* Emptying trash bins and replacing liners as needed.
* Cleaning and disinfecting restrooms, including sinks, toilets, and mirrors.
* Refill soap dispensers, paper towels, and toilet paper as necessary.
* Cleaning windows, glass partitions, and mirrors to maintain a clear and streak-free appearance.
* Monitoring and ordering cleaning supplies and equipment to ensure adequate stock levels.
* Reporting any maintenance or repair issues to the appropriate personnel.
* Adhering to safety protocols and using cleaning chemicals and equipment safely and appropriately.

  


**Qualifications:**

  


* Proven experience as a housekeeper, janitor, or in a similar cleaning role.
* Knowledge of cleaning techniques, materials, and equipment.
* Attention to detail and thoroughness in completing tasks.
* Ability to work independently and efficiently with minimal supervision.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Physical stamina and ability to lift and move heavy objects if required.
* Knowledge of safety protocols and practices for handling cleaning chemicals.
* Flexibility to work during non-business hours occasionally.
* High school diploma or equivalent qualification preferred.

title: Staff Nurse-Labor/Delivery
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


Elmhurst Hospital Center (EHC) is the major tertiary care provider in the borough of Queens. The hospital is comprised of 545 beds and is a Level I Trauma Center, an Emergency Heart Care Station and a 911 Receiving Hospital. It is the premiere health care organization for key areas such as Surgery, Cardiology, Women's Health, Pediatrics, Rehabilitation Medicine, Renal and Mental Health Services.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.


**Job Description**
-------------------

  


Under supervision, provides professional nursing care to patients/clients within an assigned unit. Diagnoses and treats responses to actual or potential health problems by means of nursing methods and techniques such as case-finding, health teaching, health counseling and provision of care supportive to and restorative of life and well-being.


**Duties & Responsibilities**
-----------------------------

  


1. Identifies and discriminates between physical and psycho-social signs and symptoms. Selects and performs those therapeutic measures which are essential for effective execution of the nursing regimen for assigned patients/clients.


2. Develops, implements and continuously evaluates the nursing regimen for assigned patients/clients.


3. Records and maintains nursing care plans and progress notes on patients/clients to ensure continuity of care.


4. Interprets and reports responses of patients/clients to appropriate members of the health team.


5. Participates with interdisciplinary health team members to plan a comprehensive patient care program.


6. Determines and assigns those components of the nursing regimen which may be carried out by allied nursing personnel.


7. Provides teaching, guidance and direction to allied nursing personnel in rendering patient care.


8. Participates in defining, implementing, maintaining and interpreting standards of nursing practice.


9. Participates in departmental and interdisciplinary conferences pertaining to policies and procedures affecting nursing practice.


10. Participates in determining conditions, resources and policies essential to the delivery of nursing care services.


11. Participates in development and maintenance of a system of evaluation of nursing care, practices and procedures, including evaluation of nursing personnel.


12. Interprets philosophy and objectives of agency and Nursing Department to patients/clients, families and other groups.


13. Maintains professional competence through participation in continuing education and other appropriate learning experiences.


14. Performs other professional nursing activities as delegated by nursing service administration.


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

  


1. A valid New York State license and current registration to practice as a Registered Professional Nurse in New York State; and


2. Holds, or obtains through facility orientation, a valid and current certification in Basic Life Support (BLS) through the American Heart Association (AHA).


Special Note: For assignments in Post-Acute Care ONLY, individuals meeting the following criteria may also be considered for appointment: Graduation from a nursing education program registered by the New York State Education Department (NYSED) as licensure qualifying for Registered Professional Nurse (RN) and has applied for licensure as an RN. These unlicensed individuals may be employed to practice under the immediate and personal supervision of a NYS licensed, currently registered, RN for up to 90 days immediately following graduation pending receipt of a limited permit, which selected candidates must apply for and receive within the same 90-day period. Once a limited permit is received, individuals can practice nursing, under the immediate and personal supervision of a NYS licensed, currently registered, RN at a NYC Health + Hospitals health care setting for up to one (1) year from the date of issuance of the limited permit. In addition, must hold or obtain through facility orientation, a valid and current certification in Basic Life Support (BLS) through the American Heart Association (AHA).


**How To Apply**
----------------

  


If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online at employment.nychhc.org.

title: Vice President U.S. Banks First Line Business Risk Regulatory & Audit
description:
Vice President U.S. Banks First Line Business Risk Regulatory & Audit

Job Number:

 3257604


POSTING DATE: Aug 20, 2024
PRIMARY LOCATION: Americas-United States of America-New York-New York
OTHER LOCATIONS: Americas-United States of America-Maryland-Baltimore
EDUCATION LEVEL: Bachelor's Degree
JOB: Operational Risk
EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full Time
JOB LEVEL: Vice President

DESCRIPTION


Morgan Stanley (MS) is a global financial services firm that conducts its business  

through three principal business segments: Institutional Securities Group (ISG), Global Wealth Management via Wealth Management (WM), and Asset Management.  

The U.S. Banks - Morgan Stanley Private Bank, National Association (MSPBNA) and Morgan Stanley Bank, N.A. (MSBNA) (together, the Banks) - provide cash management and lending products and services in support of WM & ISG clients and seek a Vice President as part of the U.S. Banks First Line of Defense (1LOD) Business Risk team.  

This individual will be responsible for supporting the Regulatory and Audit Oversight Group and be based in New York, NY or Baltimore, MD. The advertised pay is for the primary location of New York only, if candidate sits in Baltimore pay will vary.  

Regulatory Exam Support:
* Provide support & guidance to management to prepare them for regulatory examinations
* Partner with Regulatory Relations and management to coordinate the exam process for the Banks, complementing the Regulatory Relations program without duplication
* Collaborate with stakeholders to confirm comprehensive and consistent practices are followed to allow for successful execution of exams
* Ensure First Day Letter and follow up requests are responded to in a complete and timely manner by management
* Prepare and deliver weekly and monthly reporting to bank management regarding support and preparation for and progress during exams

  

Regulatory Remediation:
* Provide support & guidance to management to execute against remediation of findings
* Confirm that comprehensive issues and action plans are created to mitigate risk identified with owners and that due dates are achievable
* Monitor and challenge remediation activity to confirm that action plans are timely completed, mitigate the risk, and meet the spirit and letter of regulatory expectations
* Work with 1LOD management to address issues raised from 2LOD/3LOD review and/or challenge of remediation
* Maintain workpapers (documentary evidence) to support review of remediation activities

  


Internal Audit Oversight:
* Collaborate with stakeholders to confirm comprehensive and consistent practices are followed to allow for successful execution of internal audits
* Collaborate with management to confirm Bank engagement with Firm audits identified as having a Bank impact
* Facilitate management reporting and escalation of notable Bank-impacting issues
* Support escalation of challenges by IAD or 1LOD management regarding audit engagements
  


QUALIFICATIONS


Experience:
* 10+ years of professional experience in financial services with focus on audit or regulatory risk & compliance; 15+ years preferred
* Experience with regulatory finding remediation and issue management
* Experience at or interacting with a U.S. Prudential Regulator a plus

  

Required:
* Bachelor’s Degree
* Risk Certifications a plus
* For Regulatory Exam Support: Juris Doctorate a plus
* For Audit Oversight & Regulatory Remediation Roles: Certified Internal Auditor (CIA) certification a plus

  

Skills Required:
* Self-starter with ability to work in a fast-paced, high-demand environment, both independently and as part of a team, under tight deadlines
* Ability to manage multiple priorities concurrently, efficiently, and effectively
* Critical attention to detail is a must given interaction with Bank senior leadership
* Strong analytical, quantitative, and investigative problem-solving abilities
* Strong verbal and written communication skills; capable of delivering presentations
* Ability to build relationships and interact positively with senior management and colleagues
* Strong project/program management and reporting skills
* Proficient with Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel

  

 Expected base pay rates for the role will be between $120,000 and $180,000 per year at the commencement of employment. However, base pay if hired will be determined on an individualized basis and is only part of the total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, incentive compensation, discretionary bonuses, other short and long-term incentive packages, and other Morgan Stanley sponsored benefit programs.  

  

 It is the policy of the Firm to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, sex stereotype, gender, gender identity or expression, transgender, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, pregnancy, veteran or military service status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  

  

Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversifying its workforce (M/F/Disability/Vet)

title: Activity Specialist
description:
**POSITION OVERVIEW:** Under the supervision of the Program Coordinator, the Activity Specialist is responsible for coordinating and facilitating activity lesson plans in a specific area of expertise, working collaboratively in assisting with all activities needed for the proper operation of the program and supervising participants ensuring the safety and inclusion of all participants. Activity Specialists must have expertise in one or more disciplines, content-specific program activities or subjects that enriches the experiences of children in the Hudson Guild program.

 **REQUIREMENTS:** Must have a minimum of an Associate’s Degree or qualifying credits from an accredited university and possess a minimum of 2 years’ experience **OR** a minimum of 4 years expertise in a special area (Drama, Visual/Digital Art, Music, Dance, Cooking, etc.) and present a portfolio, samples of your work, lesson plans, etc. Must have experience working with elementary school students and/or any youth services field. Exceptional classroom management skills and ability to develop/facilitate lesson plans. Strong verbal and written communication skills and work well within a team. Must be skilled in engaging children. Must have adaptability in the workplace; including but not limited to working remotely and providing youth services and support through virtual platforms.


**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**: Bachelor’s Degree. 4 or more years of relevant experience. Expertise in a special area (STEM, Recreation, Art, Music, Dance, Chess, Cooking, etc.:) and ability to manipulate expertise into a variety of programmatic activities.

  


**RESPONSIBILITIES:**


* Develop and facilitate activity lesson plans in area(s) of specialty that foster the development and reinforce new/previously taught skills.
* Work with Group Leaders and other staff, engaging them in the lesson plan development process and modeling activity facilitation to help Group Leaders develop professionally.
* Work collaboratively assisting in all activities needed for the orderly operation of the program, inclusive of: supervising children during snack/supper, facilitating dismissal, conducting field trips, hosting special events, and other program areas as assigned.
* Supervise participants and summer interns while; maintaining order and a positive youth focused atmosphere, providing a conducive learning environment, ensuring their safety and inclusion of all participants.
* Complete necessary reports to monitor student progress and participation; daily attendance, logs, pick-up sign-in sheets, etc.
* Responsible for area materials, room organization and reporting misused/damaged materials to the supervisor.
* Professionally communicate with all staff, parents, children and community members in a polite and respectful manner.
* Uphold program policies and procedures while promoting an inclusive, welcoming and respectful environment that embraces the diversity of all staff, participants and stakeholders.
* Actively participate in mandatory professional development training and meetings.
* Perform other related duties as assigned

 **WORKING CONDITIONS:** Travel between multiple sites consisting of school, office, and community center environments.

 **PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:** The position requires constant communication with participants and co-workers; must be able to exchange accurate information in these situations. Occasionally lift 25lbs and remain stationary for long periods.

  



Hudson Guild is an Equal Employer Opportunity.
company_description: Hudson Guild is a dynamic, well-regarded multi-service agency that provides outstanding programs & services for children, teens, and adults.

title: Sales Development Representative (SDR)
description:
**Position:** Sales Development Representative (SDR)


**Location:** California/New York/Remote

  

SimpliGov is a high-growth tech start-up listed on the GovTech 100 as one of the most influential technology companies addressing the US government.


Our cloud-based government modernization platform empowers state and local organizations to rapidly improve constituent and employee experiences through online forms and workflow automation. We are a no-code solution that integrates with existing backend systems, enabling lightning-fast implementations that deliver modern and efficient government services.

 **Job Summary**:


SimpliGov is seeking to hire a Sales Development Representative (SDR) responsible for prospecting and generating qualified leads for our Sales Executives. The ideal candidate is results-driven, possesses strong and natural sales talents, and is committed to creating new business opportunities.



This position is an entry-level role within the Sales team and reports to the Director of Sales Operations. Significant opportunities are available in terms of compensation (no cap on commissions) and a career path to an Account Executive role. On target earnings are split 50/50 salary and commission.

 **Responsibilities:**


* Prospect, qualify, follow up and educate a high volume of cold leads into prospects.
* Develop a thorough knowledge of the SimpliGov platform, and value proposition.
* Use Salesforce and sales enablement tools according to SimpliGov standards.
* Support Sales Executives by prospecting and scheduling qualification meetings and product demos.
* Maintain a sufficient volume of outbound activities to achieve or exceed your monthly quota of scheduled demos and qualified opportunities.

Confidently demo the SimpliGov platform and build relationships with prospects and customers.  
* 

  

**Qualifications:**


* Highly motivated, driven and self-starting individual.
* Bachelor's Degree or relevant working experience.
* Outstanding written, verbal & presentation skills.
* Comfortable, confident & professional in contacting potential customers.
* Strong entrepreneurial personality, self-motivated and self-managing.
* 1+ years of SaaS SDR experience is a plus.
* Prior experience using Salesforce, SalesLoft, and Apollo (or other Sales automation and CRM systems) is a plus.
* Physically based in New York is a plus.

  


**Why Join SimpliGov?**

SimpliGov is dedicated to enabling digital transformation in the public sector through its award-winning workflow automation and secure forms management platform, enjoying significant success across a growing national list of public sector customers. We are privately owned, utilize the latest technology, and bring integrity and humility to our mission of enabling modern and efficient government services. In addition to a competitive base and OTE earnings packages, we also offer:


* Medical, dental, and vision insurance.
* Technology and transportation expense reimbursements.
* Health club membership.
* 401K with company matching.
* Freedom paid time-off policy.

  



All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.



The US base salary range for this full-time position is $50,000 - $60,000 plus commission and benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum targets for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.

title: Operations Coordinator
description:
**Operations Coordinator**


**Part-Time 20 hrs per week ( 4 hours per day- 5 days per week)**


**$23 per hour**


**Location: Hackensack, NJ (In-person)**

  


**About Us:** BVMI is dedicated to providing high-quality healthcare services to those in need. We are committed to fostering a collaborative and inclusive work environment where every team member can thrive. Join us in making a difference in our community.

  


**Position Overview:** The Operations Coordinator plays a crucial role in supporting the smooth functioning of BVMI. This position is responsible for overseeing various administrative and operational tasks to ensure efficiency and effectiveness across different departments.

  


**Key Responsibilities:**



* **Scheduling for Volunteers and Practitioners:**
	+ Coordinate volunteer schedules for the clinical calendar, ensuring adequate coverage and efficient use of resources, including nurses, scanners, and interpreters.
	+ Schedule shifts for practitioners based on availability and patient needs, maintaining a balanced workload as needed.
* **Banking:**
	+ Work with the Director to receive and process donations, ensuring accurate documentation and adherence to financial procedures.
	+ Make deposits for donations received in a timely manner, maintaining detailed records for auditing purposes.
	+ Collect all relevant receipts from various departments and employees regularly. Ensure all receipts are properly dated and categorized for easy tracking and verification.
	+ Empty, count, and record the clinic's donation box weekly, and deposit the funds at the bank.
* **Administrative:**
	+ Assess inventory levels for clinical operations and office supplies, anticipating needs and replenishing stock as necessary.
	+ Research vendors, obtain quotes, and place orders for supplies, ensuring cost-effectiveness and timely delivery.
	+ Coordinate with staff members to determine specific requirements and preferences for supplies, facilitating smooth operations.
	+ Run errands for mailing and other necessary tasks as needed.
	+ Update the OSHA binder and ensure compliance with relevant regulations.
* **Clinical:**
	+ Responsible for the creation, updating, and maintenance of clinical forms, including converting medical history forms to PDF.
	+ Act as a backup resource for troubleshooting all telehealth programs.
* **Cross-Functional Collaboration:**
	+ Work closely with other staff members and departments to support organizational goals and initiatives.
	+ Collaborate with volunteers and interns to delegate tasks and leverage additional support for operational activities.
	+ Participate in staff meetings, training sessions, and strategic planning discussions to contribute ideas and insights.
**Qualifications:**


* High school diploma or equivalent required; bachelor's degree in a relevant field preferred.
* Previous experience in scheduling, financial management, or procurement is advantageous.
* Strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage competing demands effectively.
* Proficiently manage multiple tasks within a fast-paced and demanding environment.
* Attention to detail and accuracy in handling financial transactions and inventory management.
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate with various management personnel.
* Proficiency in computer applications such as Microsoft Office/Google Docs and willingness to learn new software as needed.
* EMR experience preferred (Athena).
* Must have a valid driver's license and reliable vehicle; mileage reimbursement is provided.


**Benefits:**


* Competitive salary commensurate with experience.
* Comprehensive benefits package including retirement savings plan and paid time off.
* Opportunities for professional development and growth within the organization.

  


**Equal Opportunity Employer:** BVMI is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply.

  



Join us in making a positive impact in our community! Apply today to become a part of our dedicated team at BVMI.



BVMI is guided by a “Culture of Caring” philosophy; its staff is committed to working with patients of diverse socioeconomic and cultural backgrounds and a dedicated cadre of volunteer practitioners who provide care for our patients. The BVMI Healthcare Center is a NJ State licensed ambulatory care center providing free primary and preventive medical care to low-income, working, uninsured residents of Bergen County. BVMI is an Equal Opportunity Employer. More information about BVMI is available at www.bvmi.org.

title: Driving Instructor - Weekends
description:
We’re looking for passionate teachers who want to train & coach new drivers in a fun and rewarding environment - a perfect fit for new Education Major grads or Retired/Substitute Teachers!

  

Fresh Green Light is a state-of-the-art driving school for new young drivers in Fairfield County, CT (you won’t find sketchy guys driving beat-up Camry’s here!) - named Best Driving School in Fairfield County!

  



We make the process of learning to drive more engaging and more effective. We’re looking for energetic, optimistic people who care about create safe new teen driver to join our team of driving coaches in Fairfield County – specifically in the following locations:

  

* Instructors that can work primarily in our Wilton location.
* **This position requires work on Saturdays & Sundays.**
* **Weekday could be added as well in addition.**

  



We offer:

  

* Great pay.
* Paid training & DMV Certification.
* A respectful, caring and fun culture.
* Comprehensive safety protocols in place to deal with COVID-19

  



If this sounds like a good fit for you and you can answer “yes” to all of the following, we’d love to hear from you.

  

* Are you 25 years of age or older?
* Do you have a driver’s license for 4 years and clean driving record?
* Do you have experience working with young people as a tutor, coach, counselor, etc?
* Would others describe you as friendly, caring, optimistic and dependable?
* Would a background check, DMV check and drug test all come back spotless?
* Will you pass a DOT medical exam?
* Are you available to work weekends (a must for this job)?
* **Note: COVID Vaccination Required for this position.**

  



NOTE: YOU MUST BE AVAILABLE FOR PAID TRAINING STARTING IMMEDIATELY.

title: Front Desk Receptionist (R3)
description:
**ABOUT THE COMPANY:**

  

Tribeca Pediatrics was founded by Dr. Michel Cohen, in 1994, and has grown into New York City's largest and most respected primary care pediatric practice.



With over 40 locations in vibrant neighborhoods throughout the New York City metro area and New Jersey, we are truly the premier place to work and bring your family. Our incredible team of pediatricians, nurse practitioners, and medical support staff practices a unique philosophy that embraces low intervention, thoughtful medicine while delivering the highest quality of service and care.

 **JOB DESCRIPTION:** The Front Desk Receptionist is the first person and last person our patients see when visiting Tribeca Pediatrics! They are responsible for greeting and helping patients and parents. Their duties include checking patients in and out, scheduling appointments, answering patient inquiries and maintaining records for Tribeca Pediatrics offices.

 **ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

  

Front Desk Receptionists work simultaneously checking in and out patients as well as the following responsibilities:


* Provide seamless customer service
* Ensure patient information is accurate including demographic info, billing/insurance information
* Notifying parents of outstanding balance, copays as taking payments
* Facilitates patient flow by notifying the provider of patient's' arrival, being aware of delays, and communicating with patients and clinical staff
* Register new patients
* Schedule, Move, Cancel and Confirm Appointments
* Answer general questions about the practice in a courteous manner
* Fill out and send School/Camp Medical Forms
* Forward messages to RN/Providers
* Call in, fax and/or print prescriptions
* Process fax transmissions and emails through Salesforce appropriately
* Maintain an organized, efficient and professional work environment
* Keep office supplies adequately stocked by anticipating inventory needs
* Assist with provider needs/requests
* Adhere to all practice policies and remain HIPAA Compliant
* Work on special projects or task designated by department manager

  


**QUALIFICATIONS**

  

* 1+ Years of Customer Service Experience
* Excellent communication and problem solving skills
* Ability to handle a fast-paced environment and prioritize tasks based on importance
* High School Diploma or Graduation Equivalency Degree (GED)
* Must be able to provide proof of vaccination against Hep B, Tdap and MMR
* Must be present and available for the entire training period

  


**SALARY**


* Starting rate - $17.00/hr

  


**Supporting your career development:**

  

* Join a medical community of over 300 passionate providers & support team members
* Gain exposure in the medical and customer service field
* Opportunities to cross-train as a Medical Assistant for those interested after 6+ months
* Potential assignment as a trainer after 90 day review. Training bonus offered.

  


**Benefits to support your health & wellness:**

  

* After 90 days of employment, participate in competitive medical, dental and vision insurance plans paid for by Tribeca Pediatrics **or receive an additional benefit stipend of $600.00 per year**
* 401(k) Plan with 3% Safe harbor contribution from employer each year **(employees who are eligible will receive an immediately vested contribution each year even if they do not contribute themselves to their 401K plan)**
* Accrue up to 16 days of PTO/ year with the ability to roll over unused days
* Fully paid Gym Membership to select gyms in NYC and NJ
* Employee Assistance Program - Free confidential advice for team members who need help with stress, anxiety, financial planning, and legal issues
* Pre Tax Commuter & Parking Benefit
* Additional medical coverage buy up available through Aflac
* Exclusive access to preferred pricing for Pet Insurance

  


**ENVIRONMENTAL/WORKING CONDITIONS**


* Clinical Office Environment

title: Estate Litigation Associate
description:
**Estate Litigation – Associate Attorney**

Our legal team is committed to providing each client with quality counsel, innovative solutions, and personalized service. Founded in 2000, the firm offers the legal expertise of its 110+ attorneys, who have accumulated experience and problem-solving skills over decades of practice.


We are a vibrant, busy, and growing full-service law firm and looking to increase its talented ranks of Attorneys by adding an Associate Attorney with 3-5 years to join our growing Trust and Estates Department. The Trusts and Estates department manages all aspects of estate planning, estate administration and estate litigation. This is an incredibly unique platform for an associate looking to expand their skill set while growing their own book of business.

  




**Successful Candidate**



A self-starter with a strong work ethic and organizational skills are essential for this position. Must have good oral communication skills and ability to communicate and be personable with clients, court staff, adversaries, witnesses; must be true team player genuinely interested in working in a supportive, collaborative environment.


Candidate should have experience in Estate Litigation and Surrogate’s Court procedures. The focus of this position is to assist this department with respect to estate litigations, in addition, this is a unique opportunity to learn and assist with estate planning matters as well.


Although not required, the ideal candidate will already have a small book of business that they are seeking to foster and grow, while developing new skill sets.

  




**What you will need to have:**


* Juris Doctor degree (J.D.) from an accredited law school
* Licensed to practice law in New York.
* 3-5 years T&E planning, administration and/or estate litigation
* Great organization and multitasking skills relating to estate planning tasks.
* Demonstrated ability to be flexible and prioritize work tasks in an effective manner.
* Collaborative with a can-do attitude balanced with the ability to gracefully communicate with clients.
* Comfortable working with all levels of business professionals, including senior management and all colleagues at other departments in a fast-paced environment.
* Proficiency in MS Office and Outlook
  


Competitive salary commensurate with experience – Salary Range $115,000-$140,000


* Benefits: Medical, Dental 401K
* This position is based out of Lake Success, NY

title: Director of Distribution
description:
When you’re part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work. And you’ll have the opportunity for continual growth and learning in a culture that empowers your development. With revenues of more than $40 billion and the largest investment in R&D in the industry, we give our people the resources and opportunities to make significant contributions to the world.


Location/Division Specific Information
As the director of Distribution at Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc., your main role will involve ensuring the smooth functioning of all distribution centers and logistics within the sites you lead. This position supports various business sectors, including our Life Sciences division. While you will have specific responsibilities within the portfolio, the nature and extent of your role may evolve along with the company's growth.


Discover Impactful Work:
In this role, you will have the opportunity to drive supply chain efficiencies, implement continuous improvement methodologies, and develop transformation plans to optimize transportation, warehousing, and distribution. By successfully implementing these initiatives, you support the company's overall goals and success.


A day in the Life:* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to improve supply chain efficiencies and drive performance improvement
* Apply analytics to find ways to decrease expenses while enhancing the level of service provided.
* Lead and develop your team to achieve operational metrics and ensure excellent customer service
* Create and implement environmentally-friendly initiatives, ensuring adherence to regulatory and safety guidelines.
* Develop and maintain a culture of development and employee engagement
* Set strategy and focus for your sites, providing clear vision and direction to your leadership teams


Keys to Success:
To excel in this role, you will need:


Education* A university degree in Supply Chain, Engineering, Business Administration, or a related field is required. However, equivalent experience will also be considered.


Experience* Minimum of 10 years of meaningful experience in leadership, engineering, supply chain, or project management
* Previous experience in leading a regional team of supply chain leaders and professionals
* Familiarity with continuous improvement lean methodology, including Problem Solving, Daily Management, Standard Work, Value Stream & Process Mapping, and kaizen


Knowledge, Skills, Abilities* Strong analytical and financial skills, with a proven track record to identify and implement cost-saving measures
* In-depth knowledge of key supply chain, distribution, and transportation standard methodologies
* Cross-functional business experience across the Order to Cash cycle
* Experience using ERP, WMS, and TMS functionality to improve operational performance


Physical Requirements / Work Environment
In this role, you will be part of a dynamic and fast-paced environment that may involve occasional travel to various sites. Effective communication and collaboration with team members and others involved will be important.


Benefits
Thermo Fisher Scientific offers competitive remuneration, an annual incentive plan bonus scheme, healthcare benefits, and a range of employee benefits. We are an innovative, forward-thinking organization that provides outstanding career and development prospects. Join our exciting company culture that values integrity, intensity, involvement, and innovation!
company_description: At Thermo Fisher Scientific, our professionals develop critical solutions—and build rewarding careers.

title: Tax Director/Partner, Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A)
description:
**Tax Director/Partner, Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A)**  

**Location:** New York, NY (Hybrid) or Remote ( Relocation maybe considered)


**CPA certification is required**  

  

Salary $220,000 - $500,000  

  

BIG 4 Candidate ideally  

  

Brookwood is pleased to be partnering with this Best place to Work , Best of the Best Business Management Services Business within **Public Accounting and Consulting**  

  

We are looking for a Tax Director/Partner in Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A) to join our team at Anchin. This is a key leadership role where you'll guide and support our clients on tax-related matters and M&A activities. In this role, you’ll work closely with various teams, offer strategic insights, and help ensure our clients are not only compliant with tax laws but also taking full advantage of opportunities in mergers and acquisitions.  

**WHAT YOU’LL DO:**


* Develop and implement tax strategies that align with business goals to enhance tax efficiency.
* Offer expert guidance on both domestic and international tax issues, including compliance, planning, and risk management.
* Keep up to date with changes in tax laws and regulations, and evaluate their impact on our organization and clients.
* Lead and manage due diligence efforts for M&A transactions, identifying potential tax risks and opportunities.
* Collaborate with legal, financial, and operational teams to structure deals in a tax-efficient way.
* Provide strategic advice on post-merger integration and restructuring to maximize tax benefits.
* Act as a trusted advisor to clients, offering thoughtful tax planning and M&A advice.
* Conduct client meetings and presentations, breaking down complex tax concepts into easy-to-understand information.
* Build and maintain strong client relationships, ensuring satisfaction and identifying opportunities for additional support.
* Lead, mentor, and support a team of tax professionals, helping them grow technically and professionally.
* Promote a collaborative and innovative team culture that values knowledge sharing and continuous learning.
* Oversee the preparation and review of tax returns, ensuring accuracy and compliance with all regulations.
* Manage relationships with tax authorities, addressing inquiries, audits, and other compliance-related matters.
* Monitor and report on the organization’s overall tax position, including risks and opportunities.
* Identify and assess tax risks related to business activities and transactions.
* Develop and implement strategies to manage risk and ensure compliance.


**WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR:**  

**Education:**


* Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
* CPA certification is required.


**Experience:**


* At least 12 years of experience in tax planning, compliance, and M&A transactions.
* A strong understanding of domestic and international tax laws and regulations.
* A history of successful business development.
* Proven leadership and management skills with a passion for motivating and developing a high-performing team.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to connect effectively with clients and internal teams.
* Strategic thinking with the ability to analyze complex issues and provide creative solutions.


For more information please speak to Louise Wright Director

title: EVS/Housekeeping Manager - Overnight - Brooklyn, NY
description:
Crothall Healthcare
**Salary: $62,400**

**Other Forms of Compensation:**

**Pay Grade:** 10

 **Crothall Healthcare** is a Compass One Company that provides specialized, high-quality, innovative, and responsive support services exclusively to the healthcare industry. Crothall serves many of the Top 100 Hospitals throughout its over 1300 healthcare service teams in 46 states. Crothall has been recognized as one of Modern Healthcare’s Best Places to Work and Best Places to Work in Pennsylvania since 2013 and Becker's Top 150 Places to Work since 2016. A division of Compass Group USA, we have more than 26,000 team members. Our core services include: Environmental Services, Healthcare Technology Solutions, Patient Transportation, Laundry & Linen, Facilities Management, and Ambulatory EVS. Learn more at www.Crothall.com.

**Job Summary**
---------------


**Summary:** As an Operations Manager, you are responsible for assisting in directing and overseeing the support services operational needs of the department. You will coordinate the tasks of the frontline associates and will serve as a liaison between administration and unit departments, providing the highest possible level of service.


**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Establishes and annually reviews standards and work procedures for all staff.
* Plans work and staffing schedules and areas of work to ensure adequate services are rendered.
* Assists in the hiring process; interview, hiring and training of new associates.
* Orients, develops, and supervises all supervisory/housekeeping staff.
* Conducts regular inspections and makes recommendations to the facility.
* Conducts monthly reporting of goals, accomplishments, and future plans.
* Provides staff education and continuous training.
* Communicates with staff, administration, and other departments.
* Coordinates outside services (i.e. Pest Control, Window Cleaning, Medical and Solid Waste, Document Destruction, and Recycling program)




**Qualifications:**

* 4 years of support services, military, housekeeping, and/or facilities maintenance experience.
* At least 1 year of supervisory experience in support service related field with high customer/client contact.
* Ability to communicate effectively in written format and oral presentations.
* Ability to multi-task and establish priorities.
* Ability to maintain organization in a changing and stressful environment.
* Exhibit initiative, responsibility, flexibility, and leadership.
* Possess a thorough knowledge of contract administration and office procedures.
* Proficient computer skills and knowledge of MS Office products, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, and internet.
* Bachelor’s degree is preferred.
**Apply to Crothall today!**

*Crothall is a member of Compass Group USA*

* Dental

title: FOOD SERVICE WORKER/CASHIER (FULL TIME)
description:
Gourmet
* We are hiring immediately for full time **FOOD SERVICE WORKER/CASHIER** positions.
* **Location**: Kean University Main - 1000 Morris Avenue, Union, NJ 07083. *Note: online applications accepted* *only**.*
* **Schedule**: Full time schedule. 4:00 pm to 12:00 am, days may vary. More details upon interview.
* **Requirement**: No previous experience is required.
* **Pay Rate:** $17.00 per hour  

	+ *Internal Employee Referral Bonus Available*




The advertised program is a conversational recruiting assistant that helps you apply to jobs with Compass Group. Message frequency varies. Message and data rates may apply. Text STOP to opt out or HELP for help. Terms and conditions: http://olivia.paradox.ai/moSkg


At Gourmet Dining & Chartwells Higher Education, people are at the core of our business. Together we build innovative food service concepts and serve fresh, local and nutritious meals at over 270 college campuses across the country. Twice named the Fastest Growing Brand by Nation’s Restaurant News, at Gourmet Dining & Chartwells we take pride in creating opportunities for associates to grow their careers and achieve their development goals within the company.

**Job Summary**
---------------

  

**Summary:** Performs cashiering duties, including general food service work. Maintains sanitation standards in the preparation, service and dining room facilities.
  

  

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Performs prep work such as washing, peeling, cutting and seeding fruits and vegetables. Weighs and measures designated ingredients.
* Carries pans, kettles and trays of food to and from work stations, stove and refrigerator in accordance with safety standards. Distributes supplies, utensils and portable equipment.
* Stores foods in designated areas in accordance with wrapping, dating, and food safety and rotation procedures.
* Cleans work areas, equipment and utensils.
* Ensures compliance with sanitation and safety requirements.
* Uses approved food recipes and production standards to ensure proper quality, serving temperatures and standard portion control.
* Serves customers in a friendly, efficient manner following outlined steps of service.
* Interacts with customers and resolves customer complaints in a friendly, service-oriented manner.
* Relays relevant information to supervisor.
* Performs sales transactions.
* Enters sales into the cash register to ensure purchases are accurately recorded.
* Makes change, accepts declining balance cards and other acceptable forms of payment.
* Issues receipts to customers.
* Follows standard procedures for issuing cash refunds.
* Responsible for all assigned change funds and cash receipts, ensuring that cash drawer is in compliance with overage/shortage standards.
* Replenishes condiments, beverages and general supplies while maintaining service area cleanliness.
* Performs other duties as assigned.
**The Benefits**


We are always looking for ways to invest in our people both inside and outside of work to help them achieve their full potential.

**Full-time and part-time positions offer:** Retirement Plan, Associate Shopping Program, Health and Wellness Programs, Discount Marketplace, Identity Theft Protection, Pet Insurance, Voluntary Benefits, including Critical Illness Insurance, Accident Insurance, Hospital Indemnity Insurance, Legal Services, and Choice Auto and Home Program

**Full-time positions also offer** the following benefits to associates: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance/AD, Disability Insurance, Commuter Benefits, Employee Assistance Program, Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs)

**Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**


Compass Group is an equal opportunity employer. At Compass, we are committed to treating all Applicants and Associates fairly based on their abilities, achievements, and experience without regard to race, national origin, sex, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other classification protected by law.


Qualified candidates must be able to perform the essential functions of this position satisfactorily with or without a reasonable accommodation. Disclaimer: this job post is not necessarily an exhaustive list of all essential responsibilities, skills, tasks, or requirements associated with this position. While this is intended to be an accurate reflection of the position posted, the Company reserves the right to modify or change the essential functions of the job based on business necessity.
